descriptionSet.description: Angry faces of Amitabh Bachchan and Dharmendra are in the foreground surrounded by a helicopter, a ship, cannons, and men on horseback highlighted around the faces of the two protagonists.

text-en: Ram Balram
text-en: Kwakar?
text-en: edited & directed by Vijay Anand music Laxmikant Pyarelal lyrics Anand Bakshi produced by Tito

description-en: Angry faces of Amitabh Bachchan and Dharmendra are in the foreground surrounded by a helicopter, a ship, cannons, and men on horseback highlighted around the faces of the two protagonists. (gs)
explanatory comments/crosstagging: Ram Balram was released in 1980 as a big budget multi-starrer directed by Vijay Anand. (Ranjani Mazumdar) (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: This kind of poster draws our attention to two things. First, the 1970s magnified the scale of action in cinema to a level that involved large production crews since action sequences, like dance sequences, require skilled stunt men and women.22 Secondly, action came to be recognized by the industry as one of the most marketable and spectacular aspects of a film, displayed here through a depiction of technology as spectacle. (Ranjani Mazumdar) (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Ram-Balram was the third movie of Amitabh-Dharmendra after Sholay and Chupke Chupke. This movie was expected to be another Sholay. But obviously, the comparison to Sholay always works in negative way for any movie. Ram-Balram was no exception. The movie opens to thunder response with packed houses all over, but couldn’t meet the set expectations. After three houseful weeks, it fell after the fourth week and wrapped under five Crore in 25 weeks of run. However, five Crore was a huge amount in 1980 which if adjusted to today would come close to 80 Crore. The movie was distributed at one Crore for bombay territory and the rest of India it costs 1.5 Crore. Over 2.5 Crore of investment and 3.5 Crore Distribution share makes it 1 Crore earning movie which if adjusted to today comes to 16 Crore. 16 Crore distribution profit in contemporary term is for sure a blockbuster run, but in 1980 when Bachchan movies are expected much more, Ram-Balram was termed as just a Semi-Hit. (gs)
